text_block_list.text:
With the Satsuki Sho quickly approaching, I've altered Winning 
Ticket's training to have a more concentrated focus on the race.

I'm thinking over how to improve her training regimen to help secure 
her first Classics win, when Ticket herself pays a visit.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: Hey there! Oh, don't mind me. Feel free to keep working.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: Now, it should be with the exhibit stuff…

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: Yeah… An old notebook…
I'm watching the distracted racer rummage around, when—
Ring, ring…
Huh? My mentor's calling.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: Your mentor? Oh! The one who got the URA award!

We haven't spoken since I congratulated him after the ceremony. I 
wonder what's up… Hello?

text_block_list.name: Predecessor
text_block_list.text:
Hey, kid. Are you well? I hear that new trainee of yours is stirring up a 
storm, so thought I'd give you a call.
Yeah, Tickezo… I mean, our new member, Winning Ticket.

text_block_list.name: Predecessor
text_block_list.text:
So? You confident she can do it? The Derby's the top of the top. 
Only real highfliers make it into that race.

Obviously we intend to win. All of Team Sirius is carrying on your 
dream of conquering the Derby.

text_block_list.name: Predecessor
text_block_list.text: Hahaha! Right, what I said in my acceptance speech.

No one can beat her in terms of drive. She's been dreaming about the 
Derby since she was little.

text_block_list.name: Predecessor
text_block_list.text:
Good, that long-held dream is a strength that will serve her well in 
the Derby.

text_block_list.name: Predecessor
text_block_list.text:
I'm not trying to sound like an idealist or anything, but the Derby is 
where ability and emotion collide.
Yeah… I got the picture pretty clearly when I saw you talking about it.

text_block_list.name: Predecessor
text_block_list.text:
In the end we didn't win, but all that experience leading up to it 
wasn't for nothing.

text_block_list.name: Predecessor
text_block_list.text: Anyhow, you've got this old man excited to see her in the Derby.
We talk more about the team and its members until saying goodbye.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
WOW, that was a surprise. I was wondering what was up when I heard 
my name.

He said hi and that he wants you to make a real Derby trainer out of 
me.

He said hi and that he wants you to make a real Derby trainer out of 
me.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: Hehe, you got it! So long as you make me a Derby champion!

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: Wait… Is it that I win or that you lead me to win? I'm all confused now.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
Oh right, I was looking for something! I used it at the exhibit, so it 
should be around here…

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: Ah, here it is! My Derby notebook!

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: Yeah! I accidentally left it in this box, I guess.

She shows me a notebook, which has childlike scribbles about the 
Derby scrawled all over it.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
This is a record of all the Derbies I've seen and what I thought about 
each one. And…

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: My own path to the Derby is outlined in here.

Winning Ticket takes out some photo stickers and puts them in the 
notebook.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: There, all done!

The three friendly rivals—Winning Ticket, Biwa Hayahide, and Narita 
Taishin—now have their precious memories stored in the notebook.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: The next page'll be photos from my win at the Derby. Ehehe…

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: I was a scrawny little kid growing up.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
My mom was so worried she had me doing all sorts of sports. She'd 
take me to see them a lot too.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
"Sports train both the body and mind!" She sounds like one tough 
mommy, right?

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
But, like, the first race I ever saw live was the Derby. I said it before, 
but it really blew my socks off.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
The proud winner, the racers who ran against all odds and didn't quit 
till the very end, and the countless cheering fans…

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
On the way home, racing was all I could think about. I was in tons of 
sports classes, but I told my mom I was quitting them all.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
Thinking back on it, it was way too sudden. But mom said "We'll just 
have to go out and buy running shoes!"

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
I'm suuuper bad at studying, but I really stuck with racing. You see, 
it's because of the Derby that I got to meet you and all my friends!

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: So… It's my mission to race in the Derby and win it!
It isn't easy to keep running toward a childhood dream.

But Winning Ticket's still going after hers. The memory she has of 
watching the Derby that day has never faded.
choice_data_list:
We'll make sure you write about your victory in 
that notebook!

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: Yeah!

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
Sorry for going on about the Derby for so long. I get so carried away 
talking about it.
You really love it, huh?
You really love it, huh?

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
Hehe, you bet I do! I'm confident I can't be beaten when it comes to 
passion!

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
Oh, by the way… I was gonna take this home, but I'll give it to you 
instead.
The bright-eyed enthusiast hands over her Derby notebook.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
It's absolutely packed with stuff about the Derby, so give it a good 
read! It'll make your love for the race even stronger!

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: All right, see you tomorrow! Can't wait for another day of training!
After I watch her run off, I take a look at the notebook she left me.

On the front, written in giant, childlike scribbles, is "Derby Notes." 
Somehow, the clumsy writing seems to really stress how strongly she 
feels.

text_block_list.name: Narita Taishin
text_block_list.text: Huff, puff, huff, puff…
Hm? Is that…

It's dark outside. But that doesn't stop someone from running around 
the training course.

text_block_list.name: Narita Taishin
text_block_list.text: Phew… 'Kay, next I'll do ten sprints.
Taishin… She's still training this late at night.

As I watch her running in the darkness, I am reminded of an obvious, 
unchanging truth.

Winning Ticket is not the only one who's determined to win. The 
Derby is a dream and an honor for all racers.
